laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal basal cortisol (361 nmol/L) with adequate response to short synacthen (ACTH) stimulation; cortisol rose to 633 nmol/L after 30 minutes.
Normal thyroid axis (free T4: 14.9 mmol/L; TSH: 1.1 mU/L).
Serum estradiol (90 pmol/L), LH (7.3 U/L), and FSH (9.5 U/L) levels were compatible with early follicular phase of her menstrual cycle.
Moderately severe sensorimotor polyneuropathy with more prominent sensory involvement, consistent with axonal or mixed axonal/demyelinating process.

Normal thyroid functions, normal prolactin, and normal IGF-1 levels. Dynamic GH axis evaluation initially showed a suboptimal GH response to arginine-GH stimulation, but subsequent glucagon stimulation test showed normal GH response.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Suboptimal GH response improved upon retesting.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Two arginine-GH stimulation tests revealed suboptimal GH response (3.7 ug/dL and 5.73 ug/dL).

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Neonatal brain MRI with pituitary imaging
